content: Who is credited with the quote, "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends"?

That quote is often attributed to Martin Luther King Jr. It's a powerful statement about the importance of speaking up and standing against injustice, even when it's uncomfortable or risky. The full quote is: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." It emphasizes that sometimes, the most hurtful thing isn't the criticism or hostility from those who oppose us, but the failure of those who claim to be our allies to stand with us when it matters most.
